reviews.review_msg: Awful. Panders to the class with YouTube clips to 'entertain' rather than teach, makes us dumb down our papers into layman's terms, and the entire Intergroup Relations course was basically "LOOK! Look at how awful this particular racial group is & has been!!" while ignoring the fact that all major groups have a history of racism.

nice prof. very interesting studies. midterm/2nd exam  based more on remote memorization rather than logic. test is very easy if you just memorize. I found assignments easy if you just follow the instructions.
Her lecture style is boring- just goes over the slides. She is completely unhelpful with after class questions. I would avoid this prof at all costs.

have to go to class just because of the bonus questions..but if it wasnt that you dont really to go to class because her notes are pretty straightforward and easy to understand.She provides lots of examples which helps to understand the materials more,  midterms are all MC and not that hard.
Grace was a great prof, very good lecture slides and exams were fair. Paper was also very easy. Not too many readings, although textbook chapters are long. Overall I enjoyed this class.
She clearly puts a lot of work into her slides and the materials are all useful. Exams cover the material taught.

I didn't mind this class. It was pretty interesting at times, and other times it would pretty much put me to sleep. Lectures are recorded, slides are posted online - very tempting to skip! Assignments and exams were fair, I thought. Not that hard of a course.

Appears to make the course more difficult that it actually is. For example, a C ranges from 64-75%. Concepts are simple, but exams require memorizing lots of detail. Lecture style is mundane, she reads straight off her powerpoint slides.

Professor Lau speaks much too fast and is difficult to understand because she moves at an extremely fast pace. It is unnecessary to attend lectures because she reads from her powerpoint slides. That being said, if you read the textbook before coming to class, the lecture is regurgitated. A very unegaging prof who does not know how to lecture.

Wow interesting class but so much work. We read approximately 20-25 journal articles and 8 textbook chapters which were between 30-60 pages long for the most part. Exams were not super difficult but got some getting used to. Curve was very high were 88 was an A- even though it was a seminar! all in all if it was tweaked would take again but meh
